Title: ENN agrees term deal with Cheniere for 1.8 mtpa of LNG, supporting Sabine Pass expansion
Description: Chinese private energy firm ENN has agreed to buy 1.8 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis from US project developer Cheniere for a period of over 20 years, adding to an existing 13-year deal between the two firms for 0.9 mtpa of LNG that began in July last year. The deal supports the US firm’s Sabine Pass expansion project.
Author: CK

Title: European Union launches second tender today for aggregated gas purchases
Description: The European Union launches its second tender to procure gas today, allowing European firms to submit their bids for supplies to be delivered between August 2023 and March 2025.
Author: CK

Title: LNG market still in tension, competition between Asia and Europe to continue: TotalEnergies
Description: The demand-supply balance in the LNG market remains delicate and competition for supplies between Europe and Asia will continue, pushing prices higher unless weather conditions this winter are favorable like last year, TotalEnergies’ president and chief executive Patrick Pouyanne said at the Energy Asia conference in Kuala Lumpur today.
Author: CK
